head.supplied: 5/10/65 ¶ ¶ The Manchester Cotton Association, dear Prof. M'Coy, presented to my establishment a beautiful cotton-gin. ¶ Not having as yet any collection of apparatus or machinery nor a place to loc...

div.p: Unsorted correspondence, Museum of Victoria, Melbourne.

The Manchester Cotton Association, dear Prof. M'Coy, presented to my establishment a beautiful cotton-gin.
See M to I. Watts, 23 May 1863 (in this edition as 63-05-23a). Not having as yet any collection of apparatus or machinery nor a place to locate such, I should gladly transfer the gin to the Machinery department of your Museum. If you accept the gift, perhaps you could kindly send for it your cart. It is heavy.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd Mueller
On 13 October 1865 E. Heyne wrote 'by Dr Mueller's desire' to F. McCoy to notify him that the cotton gin was being forwarded 'herewith': 'I believe it to be in good working order and I trust you will receive it in the same state' (Unsorted correspondence, Museum of Victoria).
